steps.title: Make him feel appreciated with a meaningful “good morning” message.
steps.content: Make him feel appreciated with a meaningful “good morning” message. Sending a morning text is a sweet and simple way to make your partner feel valued. Think about his personality or schedule to craft a personalized message. If he’s super flirty, for example, you could crack a joke and call him a cute nickname . If he’s stressed about work, you could send a supportive text to give him a boost of confidence. Whatever you decide, be sure to express appreciation and tailor your message. steps.title: Share an inspirational quote if you’re at a loss for words.
steps.content: Share an inspirational quote if you’re at a loss for words. If you’re struggling to find the right sentiments, get help from someone else! Choose an author, artist, or public figure that the other person admires, then share their words of wisdom. Here are some great options if you want to motivate others : “Make each day your masterpiece.” —John Wooden “Don’t expect a great day; create one.” —Bob Proctor “Every morning is a beautiful morning.” —Terri Guillemets “Don’t count the days, make the days count.” —Muhammed Ali “It’s time to start living the life you’ve imagined.” —Henry James “Lovely days don’t come to you, you should walk to them.” —Rumi “When a new day begins, dare to smile gratefully.” —Steve Maraboli “It is never too late to be what you might have been.” —George Eliot “A good day is a good day. A bad day is a good story.” —Glennon Melton “With the new day comes new strength and new thoughts.” —Eleanor Roosevelt “Each morning we are born again. What we do today is what matters most.” —Buddha “Every day is a good day. There is something to learn, care and celebrate.” —Amit Ray “Every day is a good day to be alive, whether the sun’s shining or not.” —Marty Robbins “Worry never robs tomorrow of its sorrow, it only saps today of its joy.” —Leo Buscaglia “If you want to make your dreams come true, the first thing you have to do is wake up.” —J.M. Power “In the morning, instead of saying to yourself, ‘I got to wake up’ say ‘I get to wake up!’” —Erykah Badu “I am grateful for being alive today. It is my joy and pleasure to live another wonderful day.” —Louise Hay “Smile in the mirror. Do that every morning and you’ll start to see a big difference in your life.” —Yoko Ono “Some people dream of success, while other people get up every morning and make it happen.” —Wayne Huizenga “The silence in the morning holds lots of expectations and is more hopeful than the silence at night.” —Victoria Durnak “Mornings are like nature in spring…humming with the sounds of life and the promise of a fresh new day.” —LeAura Alderson “One day you will wake up and there won’t be any more time to do the things you’ve always wanted. Do it now.” —Paulo Coelho “Every morning, you have two choices: continue to sleep with your dreams or wake up and chase them.” —Arnold Schwarzenegger “Each morning when I open my eyes, I say to myself: I, not events, have the power to make me happy or unhappy today.” —Groucho Marx “When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive, to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.” —Marcus Aurelius “I remind myself every morning: Nothing I say this day will teach me anything. So, if I’m going to learn, I must do it by listening.” —Larry King
